detaileddescription.para: The MM application uses the same format for both load and dump files and does not distinquish between the two. This allows the contents of a memory dump file to be loaded back to the same location in memory if desired, providing a memory save and restore capability to the ground operators.
Each dump (and load) file has three parts:
A file primary header. This is the standard cFE file header whose structure is defined by the CFE_FS_Header_t data type.
The MM secondary header defined by the #MM_LoadDumpFileHeader_t data type.
A variable size block of binary data that holds the memory contents dumped or the data to be loaded.
Next: Symbolic Address Arguments Prev: Memory Types Up To: CFS Memory Manager Overview
